required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transpyloric Feeding for Prevention of Micro-aspiration
clinical_study.official_title: Transpyloric Feeding for Prevention of Micro-aspiration

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the effect of transpyloric (TP) feeding on microaspiration and lung inflammation in ventilated preterm infants.

detailed_description.textblock:
Specific Aim 1): To determine the effect of TP feeding on microaspiration and lung inflammation. Hypothesis: TP feeding will reduce the microaspiration and pulmonary inflammation in ventilated preterm infants. Evaluate markers of microaspiration (pepsin A) and lung inflammation [total cell counts, nuclear factor-kB (NF-kB) activation, tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α), IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, angiopoietin 2 (Ang2), high-mobility group box-1 protein (HMGB1), macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) and interferon-γ (IFN-γ)] in TA samples obtained from preterm ventilated infants with and without TP feeding.
Specific Aim 2): To determine the effect of TP feeding on respiratory support. Hypothesis: TP feeding will decrease the respiratory severity score (RSS) [Fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2) X mean airway pressure (MAP)] and number of infants requiring ventilator support. Evaluate respiratory support in preterm ventilated infants with and without TP feeding.

primary_outcome.measure: Tracheal aspirate pepsin A levels in ventilated preterm infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.
primary_outcome.description: Difference in tracheal aspirate pepsin A levels in preterm ventilated infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tracheal aspirate pepsin A levels in ventilated preterm infants before and after transpyloric feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in tracheal aspirate pepsin A levels in preterm ventilated infants before and after transpyloric feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tracheal aspirate cytokines levels (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, Ang2, HMGB1, MIF and IFN-gamma) in ventilated preterm infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in tracheal aspirate cytokines levels (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, Ang2, HMGB1, MIF and IFN-gamma) in preterm ventilated infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tracheal aspirate cytokines levels (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, Ang2, HMGB1, MIF and IFN-gamma) in ventilated preterm infants before and after transpyloric feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in tracheal aspirate cytokines levels (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, Ang2, HMGB1, MIF and IFN-gamma) in preterm ventilated infants before and after transpyloric feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory support in ventilated preterm infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in respiratory severity score (FiO2 X mean airway pressure) in preterm ventilated infants receiving transpyloric feeding and gastric feeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: Respiratory support in ventilated preterm infants before and transpyloric feeding.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in respiratory severity score (FiO2 X mean airway pressure) in preterm ventilated infants before and after transpyloric feeding.

intervention.description: Preterm infant feeding using transpyloric feeding tube (nasoduodenal tube)

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infants (birth weight <1500 grams) requiring ventilator support.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm infants with birth weight <1500 grams
- Requiring ventilatory support
Exclusion Criteria:
- Culture-proven sepsis
- Ventilator associated pneumonia (VAP).
